h3.a: Board of Education Meeting to be Streamed Live

div.p: The Ashland-Greenwood Public Schools Board of Education will meet at 6:00 PM on Monday, April 20, 2020, by videoconference. Public and media access to the videoconference is available by clicking on the link posted on the district’s website at www.news.agsp.org. The direct link to the meeting can be accessed at https://esu2.zoom.us/s/522676706 This board meeting will be held by videoconference, and no quorum of the Board of . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Board of Education Meeting to be Streamed Live

h3.a: Meal Distribution - On Monday of each Week

div.h4: A weeks worth of meals will be distributed on Mondays - See article for various pick up times and locations
div.p: In order to further adhere to the recommended guidance for social contact and distancing, a weeks worth of meals (5 meals per child) will be distributed every Monday. AGPS Staff will place meals on a table for you or your child to grab. Staff then clean and disinfect the table between each person picking up meals. Everyone’s patience during meal pick up while also demonstrating social distancing is . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Meal Distribution - On Monday of each Week

h3.a: Governor Directs all Nebraska School Buildings Closed for the Remainder of the 19.20 school year - Learning Continues

div.h4: AGPS District Continuity of Learning Plan is attached
div.p:
AGPS Families:
Again, we begin this communication with a sincere expression of gratitude for your continued support of all AGPS staff. As for all of you, our ‘work’ world has changed dramatically over the last few works. Your support and patience with us has allowed us the opportunity to focus on ‘new learning’ so that we may in turn be better equipped to support you and our . . .

div.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

p.span: Our School, with family and community cooperation, promotes life-long learning
awaken, develop and enhance the individual potential.

Notice of Nondiscrimination The Ashland-Greenwood Public School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, age or other protected status in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following persons have been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies: Students: Building Principals, Ashland, NE 68003; HS: (402)-944-2114 or ELE: (402) 944-7083. Employees and Others: Superintendent of Schools, 1842 Furnas, Ashland, NE 68003. (402) 944-2128. Complaints or concerns involving discrimination or needs for accommodation or access should be addressed to the appropriate Coordinator. For further information about anti-discrimination laws and regulations, or to file a complaint of discrimination with the Office for Civil Rights in the U.S. Department of Education (OCR), please contact the OCR at 8930 Ward Parkway, Suite 2037, Kansas City, Missouri 64114, (816) 268-0550 (voice), or (877) 521-2172 (telecommunications device for the deaf), or ocr.kansascity@ed.gov.
